review: This is the greatest invention for streaming Netflix to your TV wirelessly! It makes Netflix appear on the screen, prevents pauses in buffering, and you can still do other things on your computer without changing the stream on the TV. Regular HDMI cables don't allow for that! I only wish it would wirelessly transmit anything (such as windows media player) but I know it's just a matter of time. I can't believe how affordable and how awesome! Kepp up the good work Google!

review: I don't understand what all the hype was about. I suppose for the price, this is a good product, but I was expecting it to do a lot more. I wasn't impressed by the games or apps, finding them to be simplistic and pointless. It works well with Netflix and HBO GO. I wish however, that when watching shows on Netflix that it would stream the next show automatically instead of having to switch back and forth between my iPad and TV. That is not a deal breaker, but when I want to watch multiple episodes of a tv show, sometimes I find it less cumbersome just to watch directly from my iPad.I originally purchased a defective item from best buy. I saw it there and snagged it before mine was sent from the  amazon waiting list. It worked at first but then stopped casting, only showing the screensaver and chrome-cast logo on my tv. I spent over an hour attempting to reset it and troubleshoot over the phone with customer service before it was deemed defective. I have had no problems with my second chrome-cast purchase.This is a good item for the price and is very small and portable. I have only used mine in my home tv, but think it would be a great product for people who travel a lot and want to take their Netflix with them.

review: UPDATE 3/15/2014: Ever since Plex app made the media server available without the $4 a month subscription a couple days ago, I would say Chromecast is really worth its $35. Luckily I was subscribed for only a month before the change. I'm keeping my rating to 4 stars though because unless you have a smart device (tablet/phone), there's really no other way to control Chromecast other than from your computer. There's no remote control for this thing. It doesn't affect me but I'm sure this could be a deal breaker for some.OLD REVIEW:Very convenient if you hate wires hanging all over your living room if you want to watch internet on a big TV in the living room. Connecting my laptop to the TV is arguably more superior in every way except convenience. The only thing that keeps it from 5 stars is because there are hardly any compatible apps for it. I bought it mainly to stream from my home media server but soon realized Plex is my only option. Its a great app when it works but its a $5 app on top of the $4 a month subscription. Subscription to stream your own media that's already in your house!? Its such nonsense but hopefully soon other developers will come out with more media sharing options.  Also make sure you have wireless N router if you want a smooth stream when media sharing. But chromecast is only $35, so its pretty good for what it is. If you watch a lot of YouTube and hulu plus, and or HBO go, then this is great.
